definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
(old) rice vessel/black/old variant of 廬|庐[lu2]/(slang) (Tw) troublesome/fussy
surname Lu/abbr. for Luxembourg 盧森堡|卢森堡[Lu2 sen1 bao3]
to take out of the furnace/fresh out of the oven/fig. newly announced/recently made available
lit. the stove fire has turned bright green (allusion to Daoist alchemy) (idiom)/fig. (of an art, a technique etc) brought to the point of perfection
lit. to set up a separate kitchen (idiom); to start from scratch/back to square one/to start of on a new path
to melt down/to remelt (metals)/fig. to acquire new education/to bake again

sentences.english: We settled in, getting the wood stove going and then propping our boots around it to dry.
sentences.chinese: 我們安頓下來，生起木柴爐，把靴子放在爐邊烤乾。

sentences.english: Then they bake it in an extremely hot oven.
sentences.chinese: 最後將它置入高溫爐裏烘焙。

sentences.english: Preheater and calciner is key equipment for precalcing production technique.
sentences.chinese: 預熱器和分解爐是新型幹法水泥生產技術的核心設備。

sentences.english: The green production with hot rotating furnace and tunnel stove roast.
sentences.chinese: 該機生產的生坯採用熱風旋轉爐及隧道爐烤均可。

sentences.english: VD electric furnace is a king of degasification equipment from molten steel during steel making process.
sentences.chinese: VD爐是冶金行業冶煉過程中的一種鋼液脫氣設備。

sentences.english: This furnace is used at the Anshan Iron and Steel Co. as demonstration furnace.
sentences.chinese: 該爐在鞍鋼弓長嶺球團廠獲得成功應用併成爲示範爐。

sentences.english: Toast walnut kernels in medium hot oven, remove and cool.
sentences.chinese: 合桃肉放焗爐內，用中火焗至金黃，取出待凍。

sentences.english: Four new crematory are commissioned at the fu shan crematorium.
sentences.chinese: 富山火葬場四個新火化爐投入服務。

sentences.english: The coal fire in the hot-air heater quickly warmed the house.
sentences.chinese: 暖氣爐裏的煤火很快地使室內溫暖起來。

sentences.english: Where have you used the portable gas-fired cooker?
sentences.chinese: 你曾經在哪些地方使用可攜式氣體爐呢？

sentences.english: Peter switched on the electric fire.
Urine-Determination of chromium-Graphite furnace atomic absorption spectrometric method.
sentences.chinese: 尿中鉻的石墨爐原子吸收光譜測定方法。

sentences.english: In this paper four gasifiers were evaluated by this method.
sentences.chinese: 文中用這一方法評價了四種煤氣化爐。

sentences.english: Put it into the oven at 170 degrees centigrade for one hour .
sentences.chinese: 把它放進170攝氏度的爐中一個小時。

sentences.english: The bagua style refers to that in which all buildings surround the danlu, a stove to make elixirs.
sentences.chinese: 八卦型指的是圍着煉丹爐的所有建築物的佈局。

sentences.english: Using quartz ceramic roller is the successful crux of furnace for glass horizontal tempering.
sentences.chinese: 採用石英陶瓷輥子是水平鋼化玻璃爐成功的關鍵。

definition: to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head
enclosing frame made of bamboo, wire etc/cage/basket/steamer basket/to cover/to cage/to embrace/to manipulate through trickery
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
copper (chemistry)/see also 紅銅|红铜[hong2 tong2]/CL:塊|块[kuai4]
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
